title: macbook 12 early 2015, wont go sleep when lid closed
message: red wine damage, no too serious, i think it did not reach the motherboard, i did not see any liquid damage on the mobo,  but the trackpad and keyboard, i cleaned them, keyboard is replaced and now everything working fine except that it wont go to sleep when lid is closed, screen stays on, i set it to immediately ask for password, and it wont, but if i hold the power button for 2 sec it goes to sleep and asks for password when waked, and from sleep it comes back by opening the lid, so im not sure now, seems the sensor is good, but i have no idea where is located, so it wakes up opening the lid, but wont go to sleep when closed. I want to reinstall osx but first have to get a usb-c adapter, it has like 180gb data to backup.

title: macbook 12 early 2015, wont go sleep when lid closed
message: The replacement keyboard did not have the hall sensor installed probably. It is under a small metal cover on the keyboard bottom. Or corrosion and 3V42 is not getting to hall sensor.
